docs.snippet: As some tech sectors show signs of slowing, cloud services have created remarkable demand for highly educated engineers and mathematicians. And they are being compensated very well.

headline.print_headline: Across Tech, Clamoring to Entice  Cloud Pros
headline.main: Tech Companies, New and Old, Clamor to Entice Cloud Computing Experts

docs.abstract: Old-guard tech companies like Oracle, tech giants like Amazon and start-ups are all vying to attract engineers adept at building and running massive data centers that make cloud computing possible; demand for such engineers has reached unprecedented levels.

docs.snippet: The chat goes from new talking devices, a drone that sees things, goggles (really) and the Apple cliffhanger. (Where’s Mike, anyway?)

headline.main: Farhad and Joe Examine Silicon Valley’s Pull in Washington

docs.snippet: In an interview, Margrethe Vestager, the European Union’s competition commissioner, discusses the issues underpinning her current investigations and whether she unfairly targets American companies.

headline.print_headline: Europe’s Antitrust Enforcer on Google, Apple and the Year Ahead
headline.main: Europe’s Antitrust Enforcer on Google, Apple and the Year Ahead

docs.abstract: Interview with European Union competition commissioner Margrethe Vestager, who talks about upcoming competition investigations in 2016.

docs.snippet: Amazon, Google, IBM and Microsoft are using high salaries and games pitting humans against computers to try to claim the standard on which all companies will build their A.I. technology.

headline.print_headline: The Race to Control Artificial Intelligence, and Tech’s Future
headline.main: The Race Is On to Control Artificial Intelligence, and Tech’s Future

docs.abstract: Numerous big tech companies, like Amazon, Google, IBM and Microsoft, are competing to be main provider of artificial intelligence and have begun circling start-ups as part of 'platform war' over AI software; company that dominates long-promised technology is likely to steer tech industry for years.

docs.snippet: An abundance of opinions in nearly 5,000 comments on Apple’s opposition to a court order to unlock an iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino killers.

headline.print_headline: Times Readers Have Their Say on the Debate Over Apple
headline.main: Times Readers Weigh In on the Apple Debate

docs.abstract: New York Times readers weigh in on Apple's decision to oppose court order to unlock iPhone used by one of San Bernardino shooters.
